title: Abstractions per Section
code: prepare_plot <- function(flows,                           combine_plots = FALSE,                           scale_factor = 1,                           landscape = TRUE,                            width.cm = NULL,                           height.cm = NULL,                          ...) {  pdff <- sprintf("flows-and-bfshares-per-section_bfshare-%s_multiple-outflows-%s_%s_%s_scale-factor-%s.pdf",                 ifelse(attr(flows, "bfshare_dynamic"), "dynamic-equations-new", "static"),                 ifelse(attr(flows, "use_dynamic"), "dynamic", "static"),                 min(flows$date),                 max(flows$date),                 stringr::str_replace(scale_factor, "\\.", "-"))  kwb.utils::preparePdf(pdff, landscape = landscape, width.cm = width.cm, height.cm = height.cm)  plots <- kwb.BerlinWaterModel.public::plot_flows_and_bfshares_per_section(config = config,                                                                 flows = flows,                                                                 network = network,                                                                 ww = ww,                                                                 scale_factor = scale_factor,                                                                 debug = TRUE,                                                                 ...)  plots <- plots[!sapply(plots, is.null)]   if (combine_plots) {     n_per_page <- 2     n_pages <- ceiling(length(plots) / n_per_page)     for (i in seq_len(n_pages)) {       gridExtra::grid.arrange(         grobs = plots[((i - 1) * n_per_page + 1):min(i * n_per_page, length(plots))],         ncol = 1, nrow = 2       )     }   } else {     # jeweils einzeln     print(plots)   }  dev.off() #kwb.utils::finishAndShowPdf(pdff)  pdff }  if(TRUE) { scale_factors <- c(1,1.1,1.2) sapply(scale_factors, function(scale_factor) {    pdff_dynamic <- prepare_plot(flows = flows_bfs_dynamic,                              combine_plots = FALSE,                              scale_factor = scale_factor,                              landscape = TRUE)  pdff_static <- prepare_plot(flows = flows_bfs_static,                               combine_plots = FALSE,                               scale_factor = scale_factor,                              landscape = TRUE) }) } #> Running for id 1/35 (S04: Müggelsee) ... ok. title: Calculate Flow Statistics Per Section — calculate_flow_stats
text: Computes discharge statistics daily hourly flow dataset river section. function supports daily data (using date column) hourly data (using datetime column), depending "temporal_resolution" attribute input.

title: Calculate Flow Statistics Per Section — calculate_flow_stats
Calculate Flow Statistics Per Section — calculate_flow_stats
text: flows data frame containing date datetime column (depending attr(flows, "temporal_resolution")) followed one column per river section discharge values.

title: Calculate Flow Statistics Per Section — calculate_flow_stats
text: list three elements: per_section tibble discharge statistics per section (MQ, MNQ_years, MHQ_years, NNQ, HHQ). per_year tibble statistics per section year (MQ, MNQ_months, MHQ_months, NQ, HQ). per_month tibble statistics per section month (MQ, MNQ_same_months, MHQ_same_months, NQ, HQ).

title: Calculate Flow Statistics Per Section — calculate_flow_stats
text: returned statistics include: MQ – Mean discharge MNQ_years – Mean yearly minimum values (yearly low flows) MHQ_years – Mean yearly maximum values (yearly high flows) NNQ – Overall minimum discharge (absolute low flow) HHQ – Overall maximum discharge (absolute high flow) Additional tables contain statistics per year per month, including monthly mean, monthly minimum, monthly maximum discharges.

text: Computes yearly, monthly aggregated abstraction metrics single gallery (Brunnengalerie).

title: Compute abstraction metrics per gallery — compute_gallery_kpis
code: compute_gallery_kpis(   df,   gallery_col = "gallery",   date_col = "date",   q_col = "cbm_per_day",   temporal_resolution = c("auto", "daily", "monthly"),   date_min = NULL,   date_max = NULL )

title: Compute abstraction metrics per gallery — compute_gallery_kpis
text: df data.frame containing least gallery ID, date abstraction rates (e.g. \(m^3/d\)) single gallery. gallery_col Name gallery column (default: "gallery"). date_col Name date column (default: "date"). column must coercible Date. q_col Name abstraction column (e.g. "cbm_per_day", interpreted \(m^3/d\)). temporal_resolution Character string specifying temporal resolution, one "auto", "daily" "monthly". set "auto", resolution inferred median time step consecutive dates. date_min Optional start date observation period. NULL (default), minimum date column used. date_max Optional end date observation period. NULL (default), maximum date column used.

title: Compute abstraction metrics per gallery — compute_gallery_kpis
text: named list following elements: per_year tibble yearly metrics per gallery year, including yearly volumes (e.g. QA, NQMonat, HQMonat, Q365, Q1Ist, Q30) well number months data (n_months_with_data), number months operation (n_months_in_operation), length observation period months (n_months_observation_period) corresponding percentages (n_months_operation_with_data_percent, n_months_operation_within_observationperiod_percent). per_gallery tibble aggregated metrics per gallery full observation period (e.g. MQA, NQA, HQA, MNQA, NNQA, MHQA, HHQA, MQ365, HQ365, MQ1Ist, MQ30), together n_months_with_data, n_months_in_operation, n_months_observation_period, n_months_operation_with_data_percent n_months_operation_within_observationperiod_percent. per_month tibble monthly metrics per gallery calendar month aggregated years (e.g. MQMonat, NQMonat, HQMonat), plus number months data (n_months_with_data), number months operation (n_months_in_operation), observation-period length months (n_months_observation_period) corresponding percentages (n_months_operation_with_data_percent, n_months_operation_within_observationperiod_percent). meta named list meta information temporal_resolution, synthetic_daily_from_month, has_daily_extremes, vector requires_real_daily_for = c("Q1Ist", "MQ1Ist", "Q30", "MQ30"), effective date_min, date_max n_months_observation_period.

title: Compute abstraction metrics per gallery — compute_gallery_kpis
text: function automatically detects whether daily values synthetically generated monthly data, e.g. completing daily grid applying tidyr::fill(direction = ""). case, volume-based yearly monthly metrics computed, daily extreme metrics (Q1Ist, MQ1Ist, Q30, MQ30) suppressed returned NA, represent real daily extremes. Months NA zero abstraction excluded calculation monthly-based KPIs (e.g. NQMonat, HQMonat, MQMonat). Additional size indicators provided: n_months_with_data, n_months_in_operation n_months_observation_period per gallery, well two percentage indicators describing share operational months within observed data within full observation period.

code: library(tibble)  a <- list("S03" = list("S21" = tibble(a = 1, b = 2))) b <- list("S03" = list("S07" = tibble(a = 3, b = 4))) c <- list("S01" = list("S02" = tibble(a = 5, b = 6)))  # Default: prefer = "left" merge_two_level_lists(a, b) #> $S03 #> $S03$S21 #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>       a     b #>   <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     1     2 #>  #> $S03$S07 #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>       a     b #>   <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     3     4 #>  #>   # Right side overwrites in case of duplicates merge_two_level_lists(a, b, prefer = "right") #> $S03 #> $S03$S21 #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>       a     b #>   <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     1     2 #>  #> $S03$S07 #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>       a     b #>   <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     3     4 #>  #>   # Merge more than two lists using purrr::reduce purrr::reduce(list(a, b, c), merge_two_level_lists) #> $S03 #> $S03$S21 #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>       a     b #>   <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     1     2 #>  #> $S03$S07 #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>       a     b #>   <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     3     4 #>  #>  #> $S01 #> $S01$S02 #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>       a     b #>   <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     5     6 #>  #>

title: Prepare Model input — prepare_input
text: temporal_resolution specify temporal resolution model input dataset. (default: "days"). Valid options : "days" "hours" config model network configuration (retrieved config_read) cso cso dataset (default: kwb.BerlinWaterModel.public::cso) inflows inflows dataset (default: kwb.BerlinWaterModel.public::inflows) rain rain dataset (default: kwb.BerlinWaterModel.public::rain) evapo_p evaporation dataset (default: kwb.BerlinWaterModel.public::evapo_p) shares_timeseries shares timeseries dataset (default: kwb.BerlinWaterModel.public::shares_timeseries) ww waterworks dataset (default: kwb.BerlinWaterModel.public::ww) wwtp wastewater treatment plant dataset (default: kwb.BerlinWaterModel.public::wwtp) bfshare_dynamic dynamic bankfiltration shares used static ones contained column "bank_filtration_share" config$flows_in_out share_wwtp_sch_to_nordgraben_timeseries TRUE time series "Nordgraben" used (column name defined parameter "col_wwtp_sch_nordgraben") remaining water transfered "Panke" (column name defined parameter "col_wwtp_sch_panke") share_wwtp_sch_panke_1 share WWTP Schoenerlinde Panke (default: 0.1) date_separation_panke_1_2; used share_wwtp_sch_to_nordgraben_timeseries == FALSE date_separation_panke_1_2 date separate shares (.e. share_wwtp_sch_panke_1) (share_wwtp_sch_panke_2) given date (default: "2025-04-15") (default: 1 - share_wwtp_sch_panke); used share_wwtp_sch_to_nordgraben_timeseries == FALSE share_wwtp_sch_panke_2 share WWTP Schoenerlinde Panke (default: 0.9) date_separation_panke_1_2; used share_wwtp_sch_to_nordgraben_timeseries == FALSE col_wwtp_sch column name WWTP Schoenerlinde (default: "Q_KW_SCH") col_wwtp_sch_nordgraben column name WWTP Schoenerlinde outflow Nordgraben (default: "Q_KW_SCH_Nordgraben") col_wwtp_sch_panke column name WWTP Schoenerlinde outflow Panke (default: "Q_KW_SCH_Panke") col_panke_baseflow_no_Q_wwtp (default: "Panke_baseflow_no_Q_KW_SCH_Panke") date_min minimum date, .e. start simulation (default: "2002-01-01) date_max maximum date, .e. end simulation (default: "2022-12-31) debug print debug messages (default: TRUE)
